analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa ste / gzhon nu / 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa na de bzhin gshegs pa la mi @5a *//
translated: and I possess the wisdom of unobstructed liberation.

original: mkhyen pa'am / mi gzigs pa'am /
analyzed: mkhyen pa'am / mi gzigs pa'am /
translated: “Young man, there is nothing that the Tathāgata does not know, does not see,

original: mi gsan pa'am /🔽thugs su ma chud pa'am /
analyzed: mi gsan pa'am / thugs su ma chud pa'am /
translated: does not hear,🔽does not understand,

original: mngon sum du ma mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum du ma mdzad pa'am /
translated: does not perceive,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa ci'ang med de /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa ci'ang med de /
translated: and has not fully awakened to in this limitless and endless world.

original: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dang yongs su dri ba'i phyir khyod la rtag tu skabs phye yi /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa la dri ba dang yongs su dri ba'i phyir khyod la rtag tu skabs phye yi /

original: dri ba dris pa de dang de lung bstan pas ngas khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //
analyzed: dri ba dris pa de dang de lung bstan pas ngas khyod kyi sems rangs par bya'o //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye ba dang / zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs phye ba dang / zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /

original: 'jig rten mgon po rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: “The perfect buddhas, the lords of the world,

original: 'od mdzad ji ltar spyad pa yis //
analyzed: 'od mdzad ji ltar spyad pa yis //
translated: The illuminators, what did they practice

original: bsam gyis mi khyab ye shes 'thob //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab ye shes 'thob //
translated: To attain inconceivable wisdom?

original: phan mdzad lung yang bstan du gsol //
analyzed: phan mdzad lung yang bstan du gsol //
translated: Please explain the prophecy, O Benefactor.

original: mi yi khyu mchog mi dang lhas mchod pa //
analyzed: mi yi khyu mchog mi dang lhas mchod pa //
translated: “The supreme man, the one to be worshipped by humans and gods,

original: mi dbang bden gsungs ji ltar spyad pa yis //
analyzed: mi dbang bden gsungs ji ltar spyad pa yis //
translated: The lord of men, the one who speaks the truth, what did he practice

original: theg mchog dam pa gzhal med thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: theg mchog dam pa gzhal med thob par 'gyur //
translated: To attain the supreme vehicle, the immeasurable?

original: mgon po gsung mchog zhus pa lung bstan gsol //
analyzed: mgon po gsung mchog zhus pa lung bstan gsol //
translated: O protector, please explain the prophecy of the supreme speech.

original: bdag la g-yo ni ma mchis te //
analyzed: bdag la g-yo ni ma mchis te //
translated: “I am not deceitful,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa zhu ba lags //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa zhu ba lags //
translated: But am asking with a higher intention.

original: skyes bu dam pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Except for the holy being,

original: bdag gi dbang ni gzhan ma mchis //
analyzed: bdag gi dbang ni gzhan ma mchis //
translated: I have no other power.

original: 'dun dang smon lam rgya che bdag la mchis //
analyzed: 'dun dang smon lam rgya che bdag la mchis //
translated: I have vast aspirations and prayers.

original: bdag gi spyod pa sh'akya seng ges mkhyen //
analyzed: bdag gi spyod pa sh'akya seng ges mkhyen //
translated: The Lion of the Shakyas knows my conduct.

original: bdag ni tshig la gtsor 'dzin ma lags kyi //
analyzed: bdag ni tshig la gtsor 'dzin ma lags kyi //
translated: I do not hold to the words,

original: @5b mi dbang sgrub pa bdag la myur du gsungs //
analyzed: @5b mi dbang sgrub pa bdag la myur du gsungs //
translated: but quickly teach me the practice of the lord of men.

original: sangs rgyas theg par gces spras bgyid //
analyzed: sangs rgyas theg par gces spras bgyid //
translated: I will cherish the Buddha’s vehicle.

original: yongs su sdud pa'i chos rnams gang //🔽chos rnams kun gyi mthar phyin pa //
analyzed: yongs su sdud pa'i chos rnams gang // chos rnams kun gyi mthar phyin pa //
translated: What are the dharmas that gather in?

original: dpa' bo chen po lung bstan gsol //
analyzed: dpa' bo chen po lung bstan gsol //
translated: The great hero, please prophesy🔽the end of all dharmas.

original: ci nas mis bsten shes rab rnor 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: ci nas mis bsten shes rab rnor 'gyur zhing //
translated: By what means will humans have sharp wisdom when they rely on you?

original: mi bzad 'jigs dang bral te mi skrag pas //
analyzed: mi bzad 'jigs dang bral te mi skrag pas //
translated: By what means will they be free from terrible fear and not be terrified?

original: tshul khrims phung po gtong bar mi bgyid cing //
analyzed: tshul khrims phung po gtong bar mi bgyid cing //
translated: By what means will they not give up the aggregate of morality?

original: rgyags dang zhe sdang gti mug chags bra lte //
analyzed: rgyags dang zhe sdang gti mug chags bra lte //
translated: By what means will they be free from pride, hatred, ignorance, and attachment?

original: nyes pa kun zhi spyad pa spyod pa yi //
analyzed: nyes pa kun zhi spyad pa spyod pa yi //
translated: By what means will they be free from all faults and practice practice?

original: phan par bgyid pa'i chos rnams bdag la gsungs //🔽ji ltar tshul khrims mi gtong zhing //
analyzed: phan par bgyid pa'i chos rnams bdag la gsungs // ji ltar tshul khrims mi gtong zhing //
translated: Please teach me the dharmas that are beneficial.🔽How will they not give up morality?

original: ji ltar bsam gtan 'dor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan 'dor mi 'gyur //
translated: How will they not give up concentration?

original: dgon pa la ni ji ltar bsten //
analyzed: dgon pa la ni ji ltar bsten //
translated: How will they rely on solitude?

original: shes rab dag gis ji ltar 'phel //
analyzed: shes rab dag gis ji ltar 'phel //
translated: How will they increase through wisdom?

original: ji ltar stobs bcu'i bstan pa rgya che la //
analyzed: ji ltar stobs bcu'i bstan pa rgya che la //

original: tshul khrims srung zhing mngon dga' rnyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshul khrims srung zhing mngon dga' rnyed par 'gyur //
translated: How can one attain the joy of guarding morality?

original: ji ltar tshul khrims phung po skyon med 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar tshul khrims phung po skyon med 'gyur //
translated: How can the aggregate of morality be faultless?

original: ji ltar 'dus byas rang bzhin 'jal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas rang bzhin 'jal bar 'gyur //
translated: How can one understand the nature of the compounded?🔽How can the wise become pure

analyzed: ji ltar lus dang ngag gis kyang / mkhas pa rnam par dag par 'gyur //
translated: In body and speech?

original: kun nas nyon mongs med sems kyis //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs med sems kyis //
translated: With a mind free from afflictive emotions,

original: sangs rgyas ye shes 'tshol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes 'tshol bar 'gyur //

original: lus kyi las ni ji ltar rnam dag 'gyur //
analyzed: lus kyi las ni ji ltar rnam dag 'gyur //

original: tshig gi skyon ni ji ltar spangs par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshig gi skyon ni ji ltar spangs par 'gyur //

original: ji ltar sems la nyon mongs med 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ji ltar sems la nyon mongs med 'gyur ba //
translated: How can the mind be free from afflictive emotions?

original: skyes mchog zhus pa bdag la lung bstan gsol //🔽de skad ces gsol @6a *//
analyzed: skyes mchog zhus pa bdag la lung bstan gsol // de skad ces gsol @6a *//
translated: Supreme being, please give a prophecy to me.”

original: pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Bhagavān said to the youth Candraprabha,🔽“Excellent, excellent, young man, it is excellent that you have asked the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gcig dang ldan na yon tan 'di dag thob par 'gyur zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro; ;chos gcig po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gcig dang ldan na yon tan 'di dag thob par 'gyur zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro; ;chos gcig po gang zhe na /
translated: “Young man, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have one quality, they will attain those qualities and quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood. What is that one quality?

original: gzhon nu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa yin /
analyzed: gzhon nu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa yin /
translated: Young man, it is the sameness of the mind of all beings.

original: phan pa'i sems dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / mi mnyam pa med pa'i sems yin te /
analyzed: phan pa'i sems dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / mi mnyam pa med pa'i sems yin te /
translated: It is the mind of benefit, the mind of nonanger, and the mind of noncontention.

original: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gcig po 'di dang ldan na yon tan 'di dag thob par 'gyur zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gcig po 'di dang ldan na yon tan 'di dag thob par 'gyur zhing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: “Young man, if bodhisattva mahāsattvas have that one quality they will attain those qualities and quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.”🔽“Young man, the bodhisattvas have four kinds of sameness of mind. What are the four kinds of sameness of mind?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la tshigs su bcad de gsungs pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, spoke these verses to Candraprabhakumārabhūta:

original: chos gcig yang dag blangs nas ni //
analyzed: chos gcig yang dag blangs nas ni //
translated: Having taken up one Dharma,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gnas pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gnas pa //
translated: the bodhisattva who abides

original: yon tan 'di dag nges thob ste //
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag nges thob ste //
translated: will attain these qualities

original: myur du byang chub 'tshang yang rgya //🔽de yi sems ni gang la'ang zhe mi sdang // zhe sdang med sems byang chub sems dpa' gang //
analyzed: myur du byang chub 'tshang yang rgya // de yi sems ni gang la'ang zhe mi sdang // zhe sdang med sems byang chub sems dpa' gang //
translated: and quickly attain enlightenment.🔽The bodhisattva whose mind is free from hatred,

original: tha ba mi skyed zhe sdang med pa dag /
analyzed: tha ba mi skyed zhe sdang med pa dag /
translated: who does not give rise to anger, who is free from hatred,

original: khyad @6b par ji skad brjod pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad @6b par ji skad brjod pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: will attain the qualities as described.

original: mnyam pa'i sems la bsten pa yis //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i sems la bsten pa yis //
translated: By relying on an impartial mind,

original: rnam par smin pa mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: there will be an impartial ripening.🔽The soles of the feet will also be even,

original: rkang pa'i mthil yang mnyam pa dang // cho ga spyod yul mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil yang mnyam pa dang // cho ga spyod yul mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: and the conduct and sphere of activity will be impartial.

original: mnyam zhing mi mnyam ma yin sems bsgoms nas //
analyzed: mnyam zhing mi mnyam ma yin sems bsgoms nas //
translated: Having cultivated a mind that is even and not uneven,

original: tha ba'i skyon bral nem nur rab spangs na //
analyzed: tha ba'i skyon bral nem nur rab spangs na //
translated: free from the fault of anger, having abandoned doubt,

original: de yi rkang lag mthil yang mnyam 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi rkang lag mthil yang mnyam 'gyur te //
translated: the soles of his hands and feet will be even.

original: mchog tu 'od gsal dag cing blta na sdug /
analyzed: mchog tu 'od gsal dag cing blta na sdug /
translated: Supremely luminous, pure, and beautiful to behold,

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyogs bcur lhang nger snang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyogs bcur lhang nger snang //
translated: The bodhisattvas shine in the ten directions.

original: sangs rgyas zhing du dpal dang 'od kyis khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing du dpal dang 'od kyis khyab //
translated: The buddha realm is pervaded by glory and light.

original: nam des zhi ba'i sa ni thob pa'i tshe //
analyzed: nam des zhi ba'i sa ni thob pa'i tshe //
translated: When they attain the ground of peace,

original: sangs rgyas mkhyen la sems can mang po 'god //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mkhyen la sems can mang po 'god //
translated: They establish many beings in the buddhas’ wisdom.

original: gzhon nu / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad snyoms pa dang / phan par sems pa dang / sems khong khro ba med pa dang / sems mi mnyam pa med pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhon nu / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad snyoms pa dang / phan par sems pa dang / sems khong khro ba med pa dang / sems mi mnyam pa med pa ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Prince, the bodhisattvas who are impartial toward all beings, who have an altruistic attitude, who are free from anger, and who are free from mental imbalance attain the absorption known as the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena.

original: gzhon nu / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhon nu / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “Prince, what is the absorption known as the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yid kyi sdom pa dang / las yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / phung po yongs su shes pa dang / khams mnyam pa nyid @7a *//
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yid kyi sdom pa dang / las yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / phung po yongs su shes pa dang / khams mnyam pa nyid @7a *//
translated: the restraint of body, speech, and mind, the purity of action, the transcendence of reference points, the understanding of the aggregates, the sameness of the elements,

original: dang / skye mched sel ba dang / sred pa spong ba dang / mi skye ba mngon sum du byed pa la 'jug pa dang / rgyu gsal bar byed pa dang / las kyi 'bras bu chud mi gson pa dang / chos mthong ba dang /
analyzed: dang / skye mched sel ba dang / sred pa spong ba dang / mi skye ba mngon sum du byed pa la 'jug pa dang / rgyu gsal bar byed pa dang / las kyi 'bras bu chud mi gson pa dang / chos mthong ba dang /
translated: the elimination of the sense sources, the abandonment of craving, the engagement in the realization of non-arising, the manifestation of causes, the non-wastage of the fruits of action, the seeing of phenomena,

original: lam sgom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa dang / shes rab rno ba dang / bden pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / chos shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / yi ge dang tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: lam sgom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la brten pa dang / shes rab rno ba dang / bden pa'i rjes su 'jug pa dang / chos shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug pa shes pa dang / yi ge dang tshig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang /
translated: the cultivation of the path, the reliance on the Tathāgatas, the sharpness of wisdom, the engagement with the truth, the knowledge of phenomena, the knowledge of engagement with the analytical knowledges, the knowledge of the differentiation of letters and words,

original: dngos po rnams las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / sgra yongs su shes pa dang / dga' ba rab tu thob pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba rjes su myong ba dang / drang ba dang / mnyen pa dang / shugs drang ba dang /
analyzed: dngos po rnams las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / sgra yongs su shes pa dang / dga' ba rab tu thob pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba rjes su myong ba dang / drang ba dang / mnyen pa dang / shugs drang ba dang /
translated: It is to transcend all things. It is to understand sounds. It is to attain joy. It is to experience the joy of the Dharma. It is to be straight, supple, and upright.

original: gya gyu med pa dang / khro gnyer dang bral ba dang / des pa dang / ngang tshul dge ba dang / byams par 'dzin pa dang / 'jam pa dang / bzhin 'dzum pa dang / gsong por smra ba dang / legs par 'ongs so //
analyzed: gya gyu med pa dang / khro gnyer dang bral ba dang / des pa dang / ngang tshul dge ba dang / byams par 'dzin pa dang / 'jam pa dang / bzhin 'dzum pa dang / gsong por smra ba dang / legs par 'ongs so //
translated: It is to be without deceit, to be free of frowns, to be gentle, to have a virtuous character, to be loving, to be soft-spoken, to have a smiling face, to be polite, to say “come here” and “welcome,” and to be diligent.

original: tshur shog ces smras pa dang / le lo med pa dang / bla ma la gus pa dang / bla ma la sri zhu che ba dang / skye bas chog shes pa dang / chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: tshur shog ces smras pa dang / le lo med pa dang / bla ma la gus pa dang / bla ma la sri zhu che ba dang / skye bas chog shes pa dang / chos dkar pos mi ngoms pa dang / 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: It is to respect one’s gurus, to serve one’s gurus, to be content with one’s birth, to be insatiable with regard to virtuous qualities, to have a pure livelihood, and to be free of deceit.

original: dgon pa la gnas pa mi gtong ba dang / sa rnam par bzhag pa shes pa dang / dran pa chud mi gzon pa dang / phung po la mkhas @7b pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas pa mi gtong ba dang / sa rnam par bzhag pa shes pa dang / dran pa chud mi gzon pa dang / phung po la mkhas @7b pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / mngon par shes pa mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa dang /
translated: “It is to not abandon the monastic life, to know how to classify the levels, to not waste mindfulness, to be skilled in the aggregates, to be skilled in the elements, to be skilled in the sense sources, to engage in the direct realization of superknowledge,

original: nyon mongs pa sel ba dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang / bsgom pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / nyes pa las dbyung ba la mkhas pa dang / kun nas ldang ba gnon pa dang; bag la nyal spong ba dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sel ba dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par 'joms pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang / bsgom pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang / nyes pa las dbyung ba la mkhas pa dang / kun nas ldang ba gnon pa dang; bag la nyal spong ba dang /
translated: to eliminate the afflictions, to destroy the latent formations, to progress, to be in accord with meditation, to be skilled in the means of purification, to suppress the mental afflictions, to abandon latent tendencies,

original: srid pa las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / skye ba dran pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la nem nur med pa dang / chos sems pa dang / thos pa 'tshol ba dang / ye shes rno ba dang / ye shes la sred pa dang /
analyzed: srid pa las yang dag par 'da' ba dang / skye ba dran pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la nem nur med pa dang / chos sems pa dang / thos pa 'tshol ba dang / ye shes rno ba dang / ye shes la sred pa dang /
translated: to transcend existence, to remember one’s lives, to have no doubt regarding the ripening of karma, to contemplate the Dharma, to seek learning, to have sharp wisdom, to crave wisdom,

original: ye shes rjes su rtogs pa dang / cang shes kyi sa dang / sems ri lta bu dang / mi sgul ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang; phyir mi ldog pa'i sa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa dang / dge ba'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa dang /🔽sdig pa'i chos la smod pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang / bslab pa yongs su mi gtong ba dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'jog pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes pa dang / skye ba'i khyad par shes pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes rjes su rtogs pa dang / cang shes kyi sa dang / sems ri lta bu dang / mi sgul ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang; phyir mi ldog pa'i sa rnam par gzhag pa shes pa dang / dge ba'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa dang / sdig pa'i chos la smod pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rgyu ba med pa dang / bslab pa yongs su mi gtong ba dang / ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'jog pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes pa dang / skye ba'i khyad par shes pa dang /
translated: the level of the realization of wisdom, the level of the skilled, the level of the unshakable mind, the level of the immovable, the level of the irreversible, the level of the good qualities of the Dharma,🔽the level of the absence of the movement of afflictions, the level of not abandoning the trainings, the level of the arrangement of samādhis, the level of knowing the thoughts of beings, the level of knowing the differences in births,

original: mnyam pa nyid shes pa dang / tshig gi mtshams sbyor ba shas pa dang / khyim na gnas pa yongs su gtong ba dang / khams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / sems zhum pa med pa @8a *//
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid shes pa dang / tshig gi mtshams sbyor ba shas pa dang / khyim na gnas pa yongs su gtong ba dang / khams gsum la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / sems zhum pa med pa @8a *//
translated: the level of knowing sameness, the level of knowing the connections of words, the level of giving up the household, the level of not delighting in the three realms, the level of the undepressed mind,

original: dang; chos la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / chos srung ba dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang; 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dang; chos la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / chos srung ba dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa dang; 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: “It is to be without attachment to phenomena. It is to uphold the sublime Dharma. It is to protect the Dharma. It is to have confidence in the ripening of karma. It is to be skilled in the vinaya. It is to pacify the basis of disputes.

original: 'gyed pa med pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / bzod pa'i sa dang / bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang; 'gro ba mnyam pa dang / chos rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyed pa med pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / bzod pa'i sa dang / bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa dang; 'gro ba mnyam pa dang / chos rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa dang / chos gtan la dbab pa la mkhas pa dang /
translated: It is to be without disputes. It is to be without conflict. It is the level of patience. It is to uphold patience. It is to have an equal attitude. It is to be skilled in the classification of phenomena. It is to be skilled in the ascertainment of phenomena.

original: chos kyi chig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / chos kyi tshig nges par dgod pa la mkhas pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid shes pa dang; 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi chig rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / chos kyi tshig nges par dgod pa la mkhas pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' shes pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid shes pa dang; 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know the classification of the words of the Dharma. It is to be skilled in the definitive arrangement of the words of the Dharma. It is to know the past. It is to know the future. It is to know the present. It is to know the sameness of the three times. It is to know the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: lus gnas pa shes pa dang / sems gnas pa shes pa dang / spyod lam srung ba dang / spyod lam mi 'khrugs pa dang; spyod lam mi 'chos pa dang / spyod lam mdzes pa dang / don dang don ma yin pa la mkhas shing shes pa dang /
analyzed: lus gnas pa shes pa dang / sems gnas pa shes pa dang / spyod lam srung ba dang / spyod lam mi 'khrugs pa dang; spyod lam mi 'chos pa dang / spyod lam mdzes pa dang / don dang don ma yin pa la mkhas shing shes pa dang /
translated: “It is to know the body’s stillness and the mind’s stillness. It is to maintain one’s conduct. It is to not be disturbed by one’s conduct. It is to not be artificial in one’s conduct. It is to have beautiful conduct. It is to be skilled and knowledgeable about what is meaningful and what is not.

original: rigs par smra ba dang / 'jig rten shes pa dang; lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang pa dang / sems kyis 'dzin pa med pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems la smod pa @8b dang; sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi gtong ba dang /
analyzed: rigs par smra ba dang / 'jig rten shes pa dang; lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang pa dang / sems kyis 'dzin pa med pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems la smod pa @8b dang; sbyangs pa'i yon tan mi gtong ba dang /
translated: “It is to speak logically. It is to know the world. It is to be relaxed. It is to be openhanded. It is to be free of grasping. It is to have a sense of shame. It is to have a sense of decency. It is to reproach unvirtuous thoughts. It is to not give up the ascetic qualities.

original: cho ga yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / dga' bar spyod pa dang / bla ma la ldang zhing stan 'ding ba dang / nga rgyal tshar gcod pa dang / sems yang dag par rab tu 'dzin pa dang / sems skye ba shes pa dang /
analyzed: cho ga yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / dga' bar spyod pa dang / bla ma la ldang zhing stan 'ding ba dang / nga rgyal tshar gcod pa dang / sems yang dag par rab tu 'dzin pa dang / sems skye ba shes pa dang /
translated: “It is to uphold the rites. It is to enjoy engaging in conduct. It is to rise for and offer seats to gurus. It is to conquer pride. It is to correctly hold the mind. It is to know the arising of the mind.

original: don rtogs par shes pa dang / ye shes rjes su rtogs pa dang / mi shes pa med par gyur pa dang / sems la 'jug pa shes pa dang / sems kyi rang bzhin rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / sgrub pa dang nges par sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i shes pa dang /
analyzed: don rtogs par shes pa dang / ye shes rjes su rtogs pa dang / mi shes pa med par gyur pa dang / sems la 'jug pa shes pa dang / sems kyi rang bzhin rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang / sgrub pa dang nges par sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i shes pa dang /
translated: It is to understand the meaning. It is to understand wisdom. It is to be free from ignorance. It is to understand the mind. It is to understand the nature of the mind. It is to understand the expertise in accomplishment and definite accomplishment.

original: sgra skad thams cad shes pa dang / nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa shes pa dang / don gtan la dbab par shes pa dang / gnod pa rnam par spong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa dang 'grogs pa dang / skyes bu ngan pa rnam par spong ba dang /
analyzed: sgra skad thams cad shes pa dang / nges pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa shes pa dang / don gtan la dbab par shes pa dang / gnod pa rnam par spong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa dang 'grogs pa dang / skyes bu ngan pa rnam par spong ba dang /
translated: It is to understand all sounds and languages. It is to understand the presentation of definitions. It is to understand the ascertainment of meaning. It is to abandon harm. It is to associate with holy beings. It is to abandon bad beings.

original: bsam gtan rnams sgrub cing de la ro myong bar mi byed pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul ba dang / ming dang brda dang gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa shes pa dang / btags pa yang dag par 'joms pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams sgrub cing de la ro myong bar mi byed pa dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul ba dang / ming dang brda dang gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa shes pa dang / btags pa yang dag par 'joms pa dang /
translated: It is to accomplish the dhyānas without relishing them. It is to manifest the superknowledges. It is to understand the nature of names, symbols, and designations. It is to destroy designations.

original: 'du byed rnams la skyo ba dang / bkur sti mi 'dod pa dang / bkur sti med pa la btang snyoms su byed pa dang / rnyed pa la don du mi gnyer ba dang / rnyed pa med pa la zhum pa med pa dang / snyan pa mi 'dod pa dang /🔽mi snyan pa la khong khro ba med pa dang / bstod pa la dga' ba med pa @9a *//
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la skyo ba dang / bkur sti mi 'dod pa dang / bkur sti med pa la btang snyoms su byed pa dang / rnyed pa la don du mi gnyer ba dang / rnyed pa med pa la zhum pa med pa dang / snyan pa mi 'dod pa dang / mi snyan pa la khong khro ba med pa dang / bstod pa la dga' ba med pa @9a *//
translated: It is to be disenchanted with formations. It is to not desire respect and to be indifferent to the absence of respect. It is to not pursue gain and to not be discouraged by the absence of gain. It is to not desire fame and to not be angry at the absence of fame.

original: dang / smad pa la mi dga' ba med pa dang / bde ba la mngon par ma chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la yid 'byung bar mi byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams len par mi byed pa dang / bsngags pa yang dag pa la ma chags pa dang /
analyzed: dang / smad pa la mi dga' ba med pa dang / bde ba la mngon par ma chags pa dang / sdug bsngal la yid 'byung bar mi byed pa dang / 'du byed rnams len par mi byed pa dang / bsngags pa yang dag pa la ma chags pa dang /
translated: It is to not be pleased by praise and to not be displeased by criticism. It is to not be attached to happiness and to not be discouraged by suffering. It is to not grasp at formations and to not be attached to genuine praise.

original: bsngags pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la mi mjed pa dang / khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag dang mi bsten pa dang / spyod yul ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / spyod yul du rgyu ba dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang /🔽spyod pa ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / rigs sun par mi byed pa dang / bstan pa srung ba dang / smra ba nyung zhing mnyan pa dang / dal gyis smra ba dang / tshig gi lan glan pa la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: bsngags pa yang dag pa ma yin pa la mi mjed pa dang / khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag dang mi bsten pa dang / spyod yul ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / spyod yul du rgyu ba dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod pa ma yin pa rnam par spong ba dang / rigs sun par mi byed pa dang / bstan pa srung ba dang / smra ba nyung zhing mnyan pa dang / dal gyis smra ba dang / tshig gi lan glan pa la mkhas pa dang /
translated: It is to not be attached to false praise. It is to not associate with householders or renunciates. It is to avoid inappropriate objects. It is to move within appropriate objects. It is to be perfect in one’s conduct.🔽It is to avoid inappropriate conduct. It is to not bring disrepute to one’s family. It is to protect the teachings. It is to speak little and to listen. It is to speak slowly. It is to be skilled in responding to questions.

original: phyir rgol ba tshar gcod pa dang / dus su 'gro bar byed pa dang / so so'i skye bo la yid mi rton pa dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la khyad du gsod par mi byed cing de dag la nor sbyin pa dang / dbul po rnams la brnyas par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: phyir rgol ba tshar gcod pa dang / dus su 'gro bar byed pa dang / so so'i skye bo la yid mi rton pa dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams la khyad du gsod par mi byed cing de dag la nor sbyin pa dang / dbul po rnams la brnyas par mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to defeat opponents. It is to go at the right time. It is to not trust ordinary beings. It is to not despise those who are suffering and to give them wealth. It is to not despise the poor.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa la snying rje ba dang / phan pa'i dngos po dang snying brtse ba'i blo dang chos kyis phan 'dogs pa dang / zang zing yongs su gtong ba dang / mi gsog par gnas pa dang / tshul khrims la bstod cing 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la smod pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa la snying rje ba dang / phan pa'i dngos po dang snying brtse ba'i blo dang chos kyis phan 'dogs pa dang / zang zing yongs su gtong ba dang / mi gsog par gnas pa dang / tshul khrims la bstod cing 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la smod pa dang /
translated: It is to have compassion for those with unethical conduct. It is to be loving, to be kind, and to benefit others through the Dharma. It is to give away material things. It is to remain without hoarding. It is to praise ethical conduct and to condemn unethical conduct.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa la g-yo @9b med par bsten pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas gnyer ba dang / ji skad smras pa bzhin byed pa dang / rgyun mi chad par sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa la g-yo @9b med par bsten pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas gnyer ba dang / ji skad smras pa bzhin byed pa dang / rgyun mi chad par sbyor ba dang /
translated: It is to rely on those with ethical conduct without deceit. It is to give away all one’s possessions. It is to be motivated by altruism. It is to do as one says. It is to be constantly engaged.

original: gus par byas te dga' ba myong bar byed pa dang / dpe shes pa dang / sngon byung ba la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon du 'gro ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / mtshan ma spong ba dang / 'du shes zlog pa dang /
analyzed: gus par byas te dga' ba myong bar byed pa dang / dpe shes pa dang / sngon byung ba la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba sngon du 'gro ba dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / mtshan ma spong ba dang / 'du shes zlog pa dang /
translated: It is to experience joy with devotion. It is to understand metaphors. It is to be skilled in the past. It is to be preceded by roots of virtue. It is to be skilled in means. It is to abandon signs. It is to reverse concepts.

original: dngos po rnams yongs su shes pa dang / mdo sde mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / bden pa gtan la 'bebs pa dang; rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa dang / tshig mgo cig tu smra ba dang /
analyzed: dngos po rnams yongs su shes pa dang / mdo sde mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / bden pa gtan la 'bebs pa dang; rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba la 'jug pa dang / tshig mgo cig tu smra ba dang /
translated: It is to understand things completely, to accomplish the sūtras, to be skilled in the vinaya, to ascertain the truths, to engage in the direct realization of liberation, and to speak with a single voice.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba mi gtong ba dang / nem nur med pa'i tshig dang / stong pa nyid la brten pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la brten pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing mthong ba mi gtong ba dang / nem nur med pa'i tshig dang / stong pa nyid la brten pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la brten pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to not give up knowing and seeing things as they are, to speak with words of certainty, to rely on emptiness, to rely on the absence of marks, to realize the nature of the absence of wishes,

original: mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / ye shes kyis snang bar byed pa dang / tshul khrims dam pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la gzhol ba dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / bdag shes pa dang / shes kyi khe nyung dus chog shes pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / ye shes kyis snang bar byed pa dang / tshul khrims dam pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la gzhol ba dang / gcig pur dga' ba dang / bdag shes pa dang / shes kyi khe nyung dus chog shes pa dang /
translated: to attain fearlessness, to illuminate with wisdom, to have pure discipline, to be dedicated to meditative absorption, to delight in solitude, to know one’s self, to be content with little gain from knowledge,🔽and to be without deceit.

original: sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa rnam par spong ba dang / gzungs thob pa dang / ye shes la 'jug pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa @10a *//
analyzed: sems la rnyog pa med pa dang / lta bar gyur pa rnam par spong ba dang / gzungs thob pa dang / ye shes la 'jug pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa @10a *//
translated: the absence of mental turbidity, the abandonment of views, the attainment of dhāraṇī, the engagement with wisdom, the knowledge of what is possible and impossible,

original: dang; 'jug pa dang sgrub pa shes pa dang / gtan tshigs dang / rigs pa dang / tshul dang / sgo dang / rgyu dang / lam dang / nan tan dang / sgrub pa dang / phrin dang / gdams pa dang / bstan pa la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: dang; 'jug pa dang sgrub pa shes pa dang / gtan tshigs dang / rigs pa dang / tshul dang / sgo dang / rgyu dang / lam dang / nan tan dang / sgrub pa dang / phrin dang / gdams pa dang / bstan pa la spyod pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of engagement and accomplishment, the reasoning of logic, the method, the gateway, the cause, the path, the practice, the accomplishment, the task, the instruction, the teaching,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang / bzod pa'i sa dang / mi bzod pa dang bral ba dang / ye shes kyis dang; mi shes pa spong ba dang / shes pa la gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul dang /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa dang / bzod pa'i sa dang / mi bzod pa dang bral ba dang / ye shes kyis dang; mi shes pa spong ba dang / shes pa la gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul dang /
translated: the practice of subsequent patience, the level of patience, the absence of impatience, the abandonment of ignorance through wisdom, the abiding in knowledge, the level of the practice of yoga, the domain of the bodhisattvas,

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa spong ba dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs shing khong du chud par shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa dang /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa spong ba dang / chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs shing khong du chud par shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa dang /
translated: It is to rely on holy beings, to abandon those who are not holy beings, to understand and comprehend the nature of all phenomena, and to understand the level of buddhahood taught by the Thus-Gone One.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes su yi rang ba dang / byis pa rnams kyis spangs pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyis shes par dka' ba dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes pa dang / mu stegs can gyis ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba dang /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis rjes su yi rang ba dang / byis pa rnams kyis spangs pa dang / nyan thos rnams kyis shes par dka' ba dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes pa dang / mu stegs can gyis ma yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba dang /
translated: It is to be approved by the wise, to be rejected by the childish, to be difficult for the hearers to understand, to be unknown to the solitary buddhas, to be unknown to the tīrthikas, to be upheld by the bodhisattvas,

original: stobs bcu dag gis rjes su rtogs pa dang lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / tshangs pas phyag bya ba dang / brgya byin rnams kyis sngon du 'gro bar bya ba dang / klu rnams kyis phyag bya ba dang / gnod sbyin rnams @10b kyis rjes su yi rang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu dag gis rjes su rtogs pa dang lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / tshangs pas phyag bya ba dang / brgya byin rnams kyis sngon du 'gro bar bya ba dang / klu rnams kyis phyag bya ba dang / gnod sbyin rnams @10b kyis rjes su yi rang bar bya ba dang /
translated: It is to be realized by the ten powers, to be worshiped by the gods, to be honored by Brahmā, to be preceded by Śakra, to be bowed to by the nāgas, to be rejoiced in by the yakṣas,

original: mi'am ci rnams kyis bstod par bya ba dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bsngags par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba dang / mkhas pa rnams kyis kun chub par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i nor du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: mi'am ci rnams kyis bstod par bya ba dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams kyis bsngags par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya ba dang / mkhas pa rnams kyis kun chub par bya ba dang / bla na med pa'i nor du gyur pa dang /
translated: to be praised by the gandharvas, to be extolled by the mahoragas, to be cultivated by the bodhisattvas, to be mastered by the wise, and to be the unsurpassed wealth.

original: zang zing med pa'i sbyin pa dang / nad pa rnams kyi sman du gyur pa dang; ye shes kyi mdzod du gyur pa dang / spobs pa mi zad pa dang / mdo sde rnams kyi tshul du gyur pa dang / dpa' bo dag gi g-yul du gyur pa dang /🔽khams gsum yongs su shes pa dang / pha rol tu 'gro ba dag la gzings lta bu dang / chu bo'i nang du zhugs pa dag la gru lta bu dang / grags pa 'dod pa dag gi grags pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstod pa dang /
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sbyin pa dang / nad pa rnams kyi sman du gyur pa dang; ye shes kyi mdzod du gyur pa dang / spobs pa mi zad pa dang / mdo sde rnams kyi tshul du gyur pa dang / dpa' bo dag gi g-yul du gyur pa dang / khams gsum yongs su shes pa dang / pha rol tu 'gro ba dag la gzings lta bu dang / chu bo'i nang du zhugs pa dag la gru lta bu dang / grags pa 'dod pa dag gi grags pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyis bstod pa dang /
translated: It is the generosity of those without material possessions, the medicine for the sick, the treasure of wisdom, and the inexhaustible eloquence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bsngags pa dang / stobs bcu rnams kyis bstod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag gi yon tan dang / snying rje can dag gi btang snyoms dang / nyes pa zhi bar 'dod pa dag gi byams pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bsngags pa dang / stobs bcu rnams kyis bstod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag gi yon tan dang / snying rje can dag gi btang snyoms dang / nyes pa zhi bar 'dod pa dag gi byams pa dang /
translated: It is the way of the sūtras, the battle of the heroes, and the complete knowledge of the three realms. It is a raft for those who wish to cross to the other shore, a boat for those who have entered the river, and the fame of those who desire fame. It is praised by the buddhas, extolled by the thus-gone ones, and lauded by those with the ten powers. It is the quality of the bodhisattvas, the equanimity of the compassionate, and the love of those who wish to pacify their faults.

original: theg pa chen po dag gi dbugs 'byin pa dang / seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa rnams kyi nan tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi lam dang / chos thams cad kyi phyag rgya dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su grub pa dang /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyed mos @11a *//
analyzed: theg pa chen po dag gi dbugs 'byin pa dang / seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa rnams kyi nan tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi lam dang / chos thams cad kyi phyag rgya dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su grub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyed mos @11a *//
translated: the exhalted state of the Mahāyāna, the proclamation of the lion’s roar, the path of the wisdom of the buddhas, the seal of all phenomena, the perfection of omniscient wisdom,

original: tshal du gyur pa dang / bdud kyi sde rnams skrag par byed pa dang / bde bar 'gro ba rnams kyi rig pa dang / don sgrub pa rnams kyi don dang / dgra'i nang du song ba dag gi skyabs dang / phyir rgol ba rnams chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod pa dang /
analyzed: tshal du gyur pa dang / bdud kyi sde rnams skrag par byed pa dang / bde bar 'gro ba rnams kyi rig pa dang / don sgrub pa rnams kyi don dang / dgra'i nang du song ba dag gi skyabs dang / phyir rgol ba rnams chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod pa dang /
translated: the garden of the bodhisattvas, the terror of the armies of Māra, the knowledge of those who go to a happy realm, the purpose of those who accomplish their goals, the refuge of those who have entered among enemies, the defeat of adversaries in accordance with the Dharma,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyi bden pa'i rnam pa dang / stobs rnams yang dag par 'tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi snga ltas su gyur pa dang / chos kyi sku'i rgyan dang spyod pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyi bden pa'i rnam pa dang / stobs rnams yang dag par 'tshol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi snga ltas su gyur pa dang / chos kyi sku'i rgyan dang spyod pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa dang /
translated: the aspects of the truth of fearlessness, the search for the powers, the signs of the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha, the natural outcome of the ornaments and conduct of the body of truth,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams kyi rgyan dang / thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang / sras thu bo rnams kyi dga' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sras rnams kyi rgyan dang / thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang / sras thu bo rnams kyi dga' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sa ma yin pa dang /
translated: the ornaments of the Buddha’s sons, the joy of those who desire liberation, the joy of the eldest sons, the complete knowledge of the Buddha’s wisdom, the state that is not that of any śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas,

original: sems rnam par dag pa dang / lus yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'dod chags 'byung ba med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa dang / lus yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'dod chags 'byung ba med pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang /
translated: the purity of mind, the purity of body, the complete perfection of the doors of liberation, the complete knowledge of the Buddha’s wisdom, the absence of the arising of desire, the absence of anger,

original: gti mug gi sa ma yin pa dang / ye shes 'byung ba dang / rig pa skye ba dang / ma rig pa spong ba dang / rnam par grol ba snying por byed pa rnams kyi tshim pa dang / ting nge 'dzin snying por byed pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: gti mug gi sa ma yin pa dang / ye shes 'byung ba dang / rig pa skye ba dang / ma rig pa spong ba dang / rnam par grol ba snying por byed pa rnams kyi tshim pa dang / ting nge 'dzin snying por byed pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang /
translated: It is not the level of ignorance. It is the source of wisdom. It is the birth of awareness. It is the abandonment of ignorance. It is the essence of liberation. It is the satisfaction of those who make the essence of samādhi their joy.

original: lta @11b 'dod pa rnams kyi mig tu gyur pa dang / rnam par 'phrul bar 'dod pa rnams kyi mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par sgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / thos pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyi gzungs dang /
analyzed: lta @11b 'dod pa rnams kyi mig tu gyur pa dang / rnam par 'phrul bar 'dod pa rnams kyi mngon par shes pa dang / mngon par sgrub par 'dod pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / thos pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyi gzungs dang /
translated: It is the eye of those who wish to see. It is the superknowledges of those who wish to manifest miracles. It is the miracles of those who wish to accomplish. It is the dhāraṇī of those who seek learning.

original: dran pa mi brjed pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs dang / 'dren pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa dang / mi brtson pa rnams kyi phra ba dang / shes par dka' ba dang / ma grol ba dag gis mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa mi brjed pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs dang / 'dren pa rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa dang / mi brtson pa rnams kyi phra ba dang / shes par dka' ba dang / ma grol ba dag gis mi shes pa dang /
translated: It is the undiminishing mindfulness. It is the blessings of the buddhas. It is the skillful methods of the guides. It is the subtle and difficult to know of those who are not diligent. It is the unknowing of those who are not liberated.

original: yi ge rnams ldog pa dang / sgra shes par dka' ba dang / rtogs pa rnams kyis kun shes pa dang / des pa rnams kyis shes pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba rnams kyis rab tu rtogs pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang /
analyzed: yi ge rnams ldog pa dang / sgra shes par dka' ba dang / rtogs pa rnams kyis kun shes pa dang / des pa rnams kyis shes pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba rnams kyis rab tu rtogs pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang /
translated: the reversal of the letters, the difficulty of understanding the sounds, the complete understanding of those with realization, the understanding of the gentle, the full realization of those with few desires, the retention of those who have begun to make effort,

original: dran pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bcangs pa dang / sdug bsngal zad pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / srid pa'i 'gro ba dang / skye ba'i gnas thams cad gcig tu nges par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis bcangs pa dang / sdug bsngal zad pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / srid pa'i 'gro ba dang / skye ba'i gnas thams cad gcig tu nges par bstan pa ste /
translated: the retention of those who are mindful, the exhaustion of suffering, the non-arising of all phenomena, the single certainty taught in all the migrations and places of birth in existence.

original: gzhon nu; 'di ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu; 'di ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Prince, this is called the meditative absorption of the equalness of the nature of all phenomena, which is elaborated.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa na lha dang mi'i skye dgu sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa khrag khrig phrag brgyad cus mi skye ba'i chos la🔽bzod pa @12a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa na lha dang mi'i skye dgu sngon yongs su sbyang ba byas pa khrag khrig phrag brgyad cus mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa @12a *//
translated: When the Blessed One taught this absorption called the Expanse of the Uniformity of the Nature of All Phenomena, eighty trillion gods and humans who had previously refined themselves

original: thob par gyur to //
analyzed: thob par gyur to //
translated: attained the acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: khrag khrig phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug gis rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob bar gyur to //
analyzed: khrag khrig phrag dgu bcu rtsa drug gis rjes su mthun pa'i bzod pa thob bar gyur to //
translated: Ninety-six trillion attained the acceptance that accords with reality.

original: khrag khrig phrag dgu bcu rtsa gsum gyis sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: khrag khrig phrag dgu bcu rtsa gsum gyis sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'i bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Ninety-three trillion attained the acceptance that follows sound.

original: dge slong stong du tshang ba len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong stong du tshang ba len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: One thousand monks, in total, were liberated from defilements without grasping.

original: lha dang mi'i skye dgu las srog chags stong phrag drug cus chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye dgu las srog chags stong phrag drug cus chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: Sixty thousand beings from the classes of gods and humans purified the eye of Dharma with regard to phenomena, free from dust and unobscured.

original: dge slong ma brgyad khri len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo /
analyzed: dge slong ma brgyad khri len pa med par zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo /
translated: Eighty thousand nuns were liberated from defilements without grasping.

original: dge bsnyen lnga brgyas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bar gyur to //
analyzed: dge bsnyen lnga brgyas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob bar gyur to //
translated: Five hundred lay brothers attained the fruit of non-returner.

original: dge bsnyen ma drug stong gis lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma drug stong gis lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to /
translated: Six thousand lay sisters attained the fruit of once-returner.🔽This trichiliocosm shook in six ways:

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'ang rnam pa drug tu g-yos //🔽rab tu g-yos /🔽kun tu rab tu g-yos /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'ang rnam pa drug tu g-yos // rab tu g-yos / kun tu rab tu g-yos /
translated: it shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely;

original: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /🔽kun tu rab tu 'gul /🔽ldeg / rab tu ldeg /
analyzed: 'gul / rab tu 'gul / kun tu rab tu 'gul / ldeg / rab tu ldeg /
translated: it quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;🔽it trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;

original: kun tu rab tu ldeg /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu ldeg /
translated: it quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely;

original: 'khrugs / rab tu 'khrugs /🔽kun tu rab tu 'khrugs /🔽chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
analyzed: 'khrugs / rab tu 'khrugs / kun tu rab tu 'khrugs / chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
translated: it roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely;

original: kun tu rab tu chem chem /🔽'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu chem chem / 'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: it rumbled, rumbled strongly, and rumbled intensely;🔽it crashed, crashed strongly, and crashed intensely;🔽it howled, howled strongly, and howled intensely;

original: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur te /🔽shar phyogs dma' na nub phyogs mtho /🔽nub phyogs dma' na shar phyogs mtho /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur te / shar phyogs dma' na nub phyogs mtho / nub phyogs dma' na shar phyogs mtho /
translated: it roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely;🔽the east sank and the west rose,🔽the west sank and the east rose,

original: byang phyogs dma' na lho phyogs mtho /
analyzed: byang phyogs dma' na lho phyogs mtho /
translated: the north sank and the south rose,

original: lho phyogs dma' na byang phyogs mtho /🔽@12b mtha' dma' na dbus mtho /
analyzed: lho phyogs dma' na byang phyogs mtho / @12b mtha' dma' na dbus mtho /
translated: The south was low and the north high.🔽The periphery was low and the center high.

original: dbus dma' na mtha' mtho ste /
analyzed: dbus dma' na mtha' mtho ste /
translated: The center was low and the periphery high.

original: tshad med pa'i snang ba 'jig rten du byung nas 'jig rten gyi bar mun nag smag tu gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang snang ba des gsal bar gyur to //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i snang ba 'jig rten du byung nas 'jig rten gyi bar mun nag smag tu gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang snang ba des gsal bar gyur to //
translated: Immeasurable light appeared in the world, illuminating the darkness between worlds.

original: sems can gang dag der skyes pa de dag gcig gis gcig shes par gyur te /🔽'di skad du /
analyzed: sems can gang dag der skyes pa de dag gcig gis gcig shes par gyur te / 'di skad du /
translated: Sentient beings born there recognized each other and said,

original: kye sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes par gyur to /🔽zhes 'dzer te /
analyzed: kye sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes par gyur to / zhes 'dzer te /
translated: “Oh! Other sentient beings have been born here too!”

original: mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen po'i bar du'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen po'i bar du'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same thing happened in the great hell of Avīci.

original: gleng gzhi'i le'u ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i le'u ste /
translated: This concludes the first chapter on the introduction.

original: dang po'o //// de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dang po'o //// de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: At that time, the Bhagavān said to the youth Candraprabha,

original: gzhon nu / ngas dran pa sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
analyzed: gzhon nu / ngas dran pa sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
translated: “Young man, I recall that in the past, when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct, I became a cakravartin king.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dod cing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri 'di nyid la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar de bzhin gshegs pa
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dod cing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri 'di nyid la bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar de bzhin gshegs pa
translated: Those who wish for this samādhi and wish to quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood should, for many quintillions of eons, make offerings to the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas who are in the ten directions and in the worlds of the six destinies,🔽

original: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la ngas rin po che thams cad dang / me tog dang / spos dang; dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug ba dang / phye ma dang / gdugs dang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la ngas rin po che thams cad dang / me tog dang / spos dang; dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug ba dang / phye ma dang / gdugs dang /
translated: If you wish for this samādhi and wish to quickly attain the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood, then for many quintillions of eons on this very Vulture Peak you should make offerings to the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas, who are beyond number, beyond measure, and beyond limit, with all jewels, flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, parasols,

original: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan dang / pheb rdob pa dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang / @13a *//
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan dang / pheb rdob pa dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan dang / @13a *//
translated: banners, pennants, musical instruments, cymbals, and flags of victory,🔽and with food and drink of a hundred flavors.

original: rin po che'i gtsug lag khang rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par bkram  bye ba khrag khrig bla ma brgya stong du ma'i bkod pa thams cad kyis bkur stir byas /
analyzed: rin po che'i gtsug lag khang rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par bkram  bye ba khrag khrig bla ma brgya stong du ma'i bkod pa thams cad kyis bkur stir byas /
translated: He was honored by many hundreds of thousands of gurus with all kinds of precious temples, and with many trillions of various kinds of arrays.

original: bla mar byas /🔽ri mor byas /
analyzed: bla mar byas / ri mor byas /
translated: He was revered,

original: mchod par byas /🔽rjed par byas /
analyzed: mchod par byas / rjed par byas /
translated: worshipped,🔽honored,🔽praised,

original: gsol bar byas te /
analyzed: gsol bar byas te /
translated: and served.

original: gzhon nu / ngas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad las chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di rgyas par thos te /
analyzed: gzhon nu / ngas de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad las chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di rgyas par thos te /
translated: “Young man, I heard this samādhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, in detail from all those tathāgatas.🔽I took it up,

original: gzung ngo // bris so //
analyzed: gzung ngo // bris so //
translated: I wrote it out,🔽I kept it,

original: bcangs so // bklags so //
analyzed: bcangs so // bklags so //
translated: I read it,

original: rab tu ston to //
analyzed: rab tu ston to //
translated: I taught it,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sgom pas bsgoms so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sgom pas bsgoms so //
translated: I meditated on it with unattached meditation,

original: mang du byas shing gzhan la'ang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: mang du byas shing gzhan la'ang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
translated: and I made it widespread for others.

original: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi tha ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi tha ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po zhes bya ba zhig byung ste /
translated: “Prince, the last of all those tathāgatas was the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, King of the Lord of the Śāla Tree.

original: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de'i nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig brgya stong gi dge 'dun byung ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de'i nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig brgya stong gi dge 'dun byung ste /
translated: “Prince, the Tathāgata King of the Lord of the Śāla Tree had an assembly of śrāvakas and bodhisattvas of a hundred thousand koṭis.

original: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni lo 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa drug tu gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe'i tshad ni lo 'bum phrag bdun cu rtsa drug tu gyur to //
translated: Their lifespans were seventy-six hundred thousand years.

original: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de la ngas lo bye ba stong phrag bco brgyad du mchod pa dang rim gro byas te /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de la ngas lo bye ba stong phrag bco brgyad du mchod pa dang rim gro byas te /
translated: “Prince, for eighteen thousand million years I made offerings and honored the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, King of the Lord of the Śāla Tree,

original: lha'i @13b tsandan dang rin po che'i gtsug lag khang bye ba byas so //
analyzed: lha'i @13b tsandan dang rin po che'i gtsug lag khang bye ba byas so //
translated: and I built ten million divine sandalwood and precious temples.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de'i tshe'i tshad ni lo bye ba stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug tu gyur te /🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de'i drung du nga rab tu byung nas lo bye ba stong phrag bcu bzhir chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de'i tshe'i tshad ni lo bye ba stong phrag bdun cu rtsa drug tu gyur te / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po'i rgyal po de'i drung du nga rab tu byung nas lo bye ba stong phrag bcu bzhir chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i
translated: “Bhagavān, the lifespan of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Rājavarṣa­rāja was seventy-six hundred thousand quintillion eons.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di mnyan cing bzung ste bris so //🔽bcangs so; ;bklags so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di mnyan cing bzung ste bris so // bcangs so; ;bklags so //
translated: “Bhagavān, I went forth into the presence of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Rājavarṣa­rāja and for fourteen hundred thousand quintillion eons I listened to this samādhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, I took it up, I kept it, I read it,🔽I understood it, I taught it,

original: rab tu bton to //
analyzed: rab tu bton to //
translated: I recited it,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sgom pas bsgoms so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sgom pas bsgoms so //
translated: I meditated on it with unadulterated meditation,

original: mang du byas shing gzhan la'ang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: mang du byas shing gzhan la'ang rgya cher yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
translated: and I made great effort to teach it to others.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the youthful Candraprabha:

original: gzhon nu / de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dod cing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod na khyod kyis kyang nga bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang /
analyzed: gzhon nu / de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin 'di 'dod cing myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod na khyod kyis kyang nga bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang /
